sen.j: 南北朝時代 (日本)、山内上杉家の一族。
sen.e: Family of Yamanouchi-Uesugi in the period of Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).
A member of Yamanouchi-Uesugi family in the period of Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).

sen.j: 江戸時代、米沢藩上杉家の一族。
sen.e: Member of Uesugi family of Yonezawa Domain from Edo period.
A member of Uesugi family of Yonezawa Domain in the Edo period.

Noritaka UESUGI (the period of Northern and Southern Courts)
Noritaka UESUGI (the period of Northern and Southern Courts)
Noritaka UESUGI (the period of Northern and Southern Courts)

sen.j: 上杉 憲孝（うえすぎ のりたか、1366年（正平 (日本)21年/貞治5年） - 1394年（応永元年）？）は南北朝時代 (日本)から室町時代前期にかけての武将。
sen.e: Noritaka UESUGI (1366 - 1394) was a busho (Japanese military commander) from the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan) to the beginning of Muromachi period.
Noritaka UESUGI (1366 - 1394) was a busho (Japanese military commander) from the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan) to the beginning of Muromachi period.
Noritaka UESUGI (1366 - 1394) was a busho (Japanese military commander) from the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan) to the beginning of Muromachi period.
Son of Norikata UESUGI.
Son of Norikata UESUGI.
Son of Norikata UESUGI.
From Yamanouchi-Uesugi family.
From Yamanouchi-Uesugi family.
From Yamanouchi-Uesugi family.

sen.j: 伯父・上杉能憲の養嗣子となって詫間上杉家の家督を継いだ。
sen.e: He became an adopted heir of his uncle Yoshinori UESUGI and succeeded the family estate.
He became an adopted heir of his uncle Yoshinori UESUGI and succeeded to the family estate of the Takuma-Uesugi family.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れあり。「詫間上杉家の」の訳を追記
sen.e: He became an adopted heir of his uncle Yoshinori UESUGI and succeeded to the family estate of the Takuma-Uesugi family.

sen.j: 小山若犬丸の反乱鎮圧など、実父の憲方に従って多くの戦功を挙げ、1392年に実父の後を受けて関東管領に就任した。
sen.e: He was distinguished in war service by following orders from his own father, such as suppression of the rebellion by Wakainumaru OYAMA, and in 1392 he was appointed as Kanto Kanrei (shogunal deputy for the Kanto region) after his father.

He was distinguished in war service by following orders from his own father, such as suppression of the rebellion by Wakainumaru OYAMA, and in 1392 he was appointed as Kanto Kanrei (shogunal deputy for the Kanto region) after his father.

He was distinguished in war service by following orders from his own father, such as suppression of the rebellion by Wakainumaru OYAMA, and in 1392 he was appointed as Kanto Kanrei (shogunal deputy for the Kanto region) after his father.

sen.j: しかし1394年11月、病のために管領職を辞し、まもなく死去した。
sen.e: However in 1394 November, he resignates from Kanryo shoku (a post chief advisor) due to illness, and dies shortly after.
However in November 1394, he resigned from Kanryo shoku (a post of Chief Adviser) due to illness, and died shortly after.
sen.cmt: resignates を resigned に変更、その他表現の見直し
sen.e: However in November 1394, he resigned from Kanryo shoku (a post of Chief Adviser) due to illness, and died shortly after.

sen.j: 上杉 憲孝（うえすぎ のりたか、1692年（元禄5年） - 1708年（宝永5年））は江戸時代中期の人物。
sen.e: Noritaka UESUGI (1692 - 1708) - Person from the mid Edo period.
Noritaka UESUGI (1692 - 1708) - Person in the mid Edo period.
Noritaka UESUGI (1692 - 1708) - Person in the mid Edo period.

sen.j: 米沢藩藩主上杉綱憲の三男で、生母は樫田氏の娘。
sen.e: Third son of Tsunanori UESUGI who was the lord of the Yonezawa Domain, and a real mother was the daughter of Kashida clan.
Noritaka was the third son of Tsunanori UESUGI, who was the lord of the Yonezawa Domain, and the real mother was a daughter of the Kashida clan.
Noritaka was the third son of Tsunanori UESUGI, who was the lord of the Yonezawa Domain, and the real mother was a daughter of the Kashida clan.
He died of an early age.
He died young.
